intro: Turnera tapajoensis, commonly known as the Tapajós turnera, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has heart-shaped leaves with a smooth texture. Its flowers bloom in clusters and are often visited by bees and other pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species within its habitat.
